text: Richard Allen Lupoff (February 21, 1935 – October 22, 2020) was an American science fiction and mystery author. He was an expert on the writing of Edgar Rice Burroughs and H. P. Lovecraft. He was born in New York City. Lupoff was known for his works Master of Adventure: The Worlds of Edgar Rice Burroughs, Space War Blues, 12:01 PM and Lovecraft's Book. Lupoff died on October 22, 2020 in Berkeley, California at the age of 85."Richard A.
